results.title: The Sting
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Edith Head, Albert Whitlock, George Roy Hill, Julia Phillips, Michael Phillips, David S. Ward, Tony Bill and Zanuck/Brown Productions
results.brief_description: Set in the 1930s this intricate caper deals with an ambitious small-time crook and a veteran con man who seek revenge on a vicious crime lord who murdered one of their gang.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, Edith Head, Albert Whitlock, George Roy Hill, Julia Phillips, Michael Phillips, David S. Ward, Tony Bill and Zanuck/Brown Productions

results.title: The Square
results.creator_credit: Igloo Films, New South Wales Film & Television Office, Film Depot Pty. Ltd., Blue-Tongue Films, Australian Film Finance Corporation, Joel Edgerton, Nash Edgerton, Matthew Dabner, Louise Smith, Elizabeth Mary Moore and Sally Sharpe
results.brief_description: Ray, a construction worker trapped in an unhappy marriage, pursues an affair with his neighbor, Carla. Carla’s husband, Greg, is a mobster who keeps large sums of drug money in their home. With this in mind, Carla comes up with a plan: She and Ray will steal Greg’s money, burn down her house, convince Greg the money was lost in the fire and then run away together. Carla’s scheme, however, doesn’t go off as planned.

constellations_other.name: True blue, true crime
constellations_other.description: Robert Connolly's The Dry is a recent Australian crime blockbuster, but the writer, director and producer's first film (and first crime film) connects to a longstanding tradition of true-blue crime stories from some of our greatest filmmakers.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Igloo Films, New South Wales Film & Television Office, Film Depot Pty. Ltd., Blue-Tongue Films, Australian Film Finance Corporation, Joel Edgerton, Nash Edgerton, Matthew Dabner, Louise Smith, Elizabeth Mary Moore and Sally Sharpe
results.description:
Blue-Tongue Films, Australia’s home of neo-noir, cuts their teeth with brothers Nash and Joel Edgerton taking on a domestic disturbance with disastrous consequences.

If there was a force most responsible for the wave of Australian neo-noir kicking off in the naughts, it would be Blue-Tongue Films, the Aussie film collective comprised of – among others – Kieran Darcy-Smith, Luke Doolan, Mirrah Foulkes, David Michôd and Edgerton brothers Nash and Joel. Between their features like Animal Kingdom (2010) and The Magician (2005), and a long catalogue of award-winning shorts, the group’s innate understanding of the rules of the genre mean they’re well-equipped when it comes to subverting them. That’s certainly the case with The Square, directed by Nash, written by Joel, and produced by the pair.

In some aspects a black comedy of errors, it follows Raymond (David Roberts) and Carla (Claire van der Boom) whose ongoing affair has disastrous consequences as seemingly good people make bad decisions. Populated with a who’s who of Aussie day players like Bill Hunter, Anthony Hayes, Damon Herriman and Blue-Tongue boys Darcy-Smith, Doolan and Joel Edgerton filling out the supporting roles, The Square is a nasty lil’ domestic thriller. Earmarking the promise of not just the Edgertons as filmmakers but the collective as a whole, it’s an intricate web of deceit, drama and discomfort that manifests in suburban mayhem.
description_for_label:

That’s certainly the case with The Square, directed by Nash, written by Joel, and produced by the pair.

Populated with a who’s who of Aussie day players like Bill Hunter, Anthony Hayes, Damon Herriman and Blue-Tongue boys Darcy-Smith, Doolan and Joel Edgerton filling out the supporting roles, The Square is a nasty lil’ domestic thriller. Earmarking the promise of not just the Edgertons as filmmakers but the collective as a whole, it’s an intricate web of deceit, drama and discomfort that manifests in suburban mayhem.

results.title: The Social Network
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Relativity Media, Scott Rudin Productions, Michael De Luca Productions, Trigger Street Productions, Sony Pictures, Aaron Sorkin, Scott Rudin, Donald Graham Burt, Michael De Luca, Dana Brunetti, David Fincher, Ceán Chaffin, David E. Scott and Jacqueline West
results.brief_description: David Fincher takes on the shady beginnings of Facebook with a script from Aaron Sorkin.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Columbia Pictures, Relativity Media, Scott Rudin Productions, Michael De Luca Productions, Trigger Street Productions, Sony Pictures, Aaron Sorkin, Scott Rudin, Donald Graham Burt, Michael De Luca, Dana Brunetti, David Fincher, Ceán Chaffin, David E. Scott and Jacqueline West
results.description: In 2003, Harvard undergrad Mark Zuckerberg creates a social networking site called Facebook with the help of his friend Eduardo Saverin. Though it turns out to be a successful venture, he severs ties with several people along the way.
description_for_label: In 2003, Harvard undergrad Mark Zuckerberg creates a social networking site called Facebook with the help of his friend Eduardo Saverin. Though it turns out to be a successful venture, he severs ties with several people along the way.

results.title: The Secret Life of Us
results.brief_description: The Secret Life of Us is an Australian television drama series about the lives of 20-30 somethings living in the early 2000s.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

results.description: The Secret Life of Us is an Australian television drama series about the lives of 20-30 somethings living in the early 2000s.
description_for_label: The Secret Life of Us is an Australian television drama series about the lives of 20-30 somethings living in the early 2000s.

results.title: The Royal Tour of Queen Elizabeth and Philip
results.brief_description: This 1954 film—-50,000 Royal miles in CinemaScope and Eastman Color/Colour—-covers the earlier-in-the-year six-months tour of the British Commonwealth by Queen Elizabeth and Philip, later joined by Prince Charles and Princess Anne toward the end of the trip. Those who wish can add the above four to the cast, but the thought here is they don’t qualify as actors. At least, not in the normal sense. The footage includes visits to the Fiji Islands, Tongo, the Cocos Islands, Ceylon, Africa, New Zealand and Australia. Lots of native music and tribal dances and scenery inbetween many, many shots of the Royal pair arriving and departing. The title is the plot.

results.title: The Rover
results.creator_credit: David Michôd, Josephine Ford, Cappi Ireland, Porchlight Films, Screen Australia, Screen NSW, Blue-Tongue Films, Lava Bear Films, South Australian Film Corporation, Joel Edgerton, David Linde and Liz Watts
results.brief_description: 10 years after a global economic collapse, a hardened loner pursues the men who stole his car through the lawless wasteland of the Australian outback, aided by the brother of one of the thieves.

constellations_other.name: True blue, true crime

results.title: The Road
results.creator_credit: Dimension Films, 2929 Productions, Nick Wechsler Productions, Chockstone Pictures, Chris Kennedy, Paula Mae Schwartz, Steve Schwartz, Margot Wilson, Joe Penhall, Nick Wechsler and John Hillcoat
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Cormac McCarthy’s bleak apocalyptic novel starring Viggo Mortensen, Australian actor Kodi Smit-McPhee and Charlise Theron.

constellations_other.name: Outlaws and the end
constellations_other.description: Tracing connections from Sweet Country to Australian westerns and resistance to white colonial narratives.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Dimension Films, 2929 Productions, Nick Wechsler Productions, Chockstone Pictures, Chris Kennedy, Paula Mae Schwartz, Steve Schwartz, Margot Wilson, Joe Penhall, Nick Wechsler and John Hillcoat
results.description: A father and his son walk alone through burned America. Nothing moves in the ravaged landscape save the ash on the wind and water. It is cold enough to crack stones, and, when the snow falls it is gray. The sky is dark. Their destination is the warmer south, although they don’t know what, if anything, awaits them there.
description_for_label: A father and his son walk alone through burned America. Nothing moves in the ravaged landscape save the ash on the wind and water. It is cold enough to crack stones, and, when the snow falls it is gray. The sky is dark. Their destination is the warmer south, although they don’t know what, if anything, awaits them there.

results.title: The Queen in Australia
results.brief_description: In 1954, recently crowned Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh embarked on a two month tour of Australia.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

results.description: In 1954, recently crowned Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh embarked on a two month tour of Australia. It involved some 10,000 miles of travel by air and 4,000 miles by land and sea. The couple visited every state in the nation, and turned up at all sorts of events, from tennis at Kooyong to steel mills in Newcastle to woodchopping at Wagga to the Flying Doctor Service Service at Broken Hill. The film production arm of the federal government - the Film Division of the News and Information Bureau of the Department of the Interior - decided to cover the tour in 35mm colour film, sending the footage to England for processing and editing. Six weeks after the tour ended, the film was finished and became the first feature-length Australian film shot and financed by Australians in colour to be given a theatrical release.
description_for_label: In 1954, recently crowned Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh embarked on a two month tour of Australia. It involved some 10,000 miles of travel by air and 4,000 miles by land and sea. The couple visited every state in the nation, and turned up at all sorts of events, from tennis at Kooyong to steel mills in Newcastle to woodchopping at Wagga to the Flying Doctor Service Service at Broken Hill. The film production arm of the federal government - the Film Division of the News and Information Bureau of the Department of the Interior - decided to cover the tour in 35mm colour film, sending the footage to England for processing and editing. Six weeks after the tour ended, the film was finished and became the first feature-length Australian film shot and financed by Australians in colour to be given a theatrical release.

results.title: The Queen's Corgi
results.creator_credit: nWave Pictures, Belga Productions, Ben Stassen, John R. Smith, Rob Sprackling, Caroline Van Iseghem and Vincent Kesteloot
results.brief_description: When the Queen’s favourite dog, Rex, becomes lost, he must make new friends and embrace new adventures in order to find his way back to the palace.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

results.creator_credit_for_label: nWave Pictures, Belga Productions, Ben Stassen, John R. Smith, Rob Sprackling, Caroline Van Iseghem and Vincent Kesteloot
results.description: Since his arrival at Buckingham palace, Rex lives a life of luxury. Top dog, he has superseded his three fellow Corgis in Her Majesty’s heart. His arrogance can be quite irritating. When he causes a diplomatic incident during an official dinner with the President of the United States, he falls into disgrace. Betrayed by one of his peers, Rex becomes a stray dog in the streets of London. How can he redeem himself? In love, he will find the resources to surpass himself in the face of great danger…
description_for_label: Since his arrival at Buckingham palace, Rex lives a life of luxury. Top dog, he has superseded his three fellow Corgis in Her Majesty’s heart. results.title: The Queen
results.creator_credit: BIM Distribuzione, Granada Productions, Scott Rudin Productions, Future Films, Pathé Pictures International, Pathé Renn Productions, Canal+, France 3 Cinéma, Consolata Boyle, Alan MacDonald, Andy Harries, Stephen Frears, Christine Langan, Peter Morgan and Tracey Seaward
results.headline_credit: France, Italy, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2006
results.brief_description: The Queen is an intimate behind the scenes glimpse at the interaction between HM Elizabeth II and Prime Minister Tony Blair during their struggle, following the death of Diana, to reach a compromise between what was a private tragedy for the Royal family and the public’s demand for an overt display of mourning.
